title: Monsoon Update – Cold Wave Continues, Heavy Rainfall Expected in These States - Timesbull
article_text:
INDIA
2 min.Read
Monsoon Update – Cold Wave Continues, Heavy Rainfall Expected in These States
Heavy Rain Update
By
Vipin Kumar
January 21, 2026 - 6:54 AM

Monsoon Update: Northern states of India are experiencing severe cold. In Uttar Pradesh and Delhi-NCR, sunshine has been observed after 10 AM for the past two days, leading to a rise in temperature and providing relief from the cold wave. People are coming out of their homes to enjoy the sunshine.

- Advertisement -

In Kashmir, Rajasthan, and some other areas, the temperature rise has brought some relief. A Western Disturbance and westerly winds may once again affect normal life. Rain is also expected in several parts of North India. Meanwhile, temperatures have also risen in some parts of Kashmir and Himachal Pradesh. You can find detailed weather information below.

Read More: Do you have old ₹1, ₹5, and ₹10 notes lying around at home? You could get up to ₹1 lakh!

- Advertisement -

Read More: PM Surya Ghar Scheme 2026: Free Solar Power and Subsidy for 1 Crore Families, Check Details

Rain is expected in Delhi.

According to the Meteorological Department, light clouds are expected in the national capital, Delhi, on Wednesday. ​​Fog may also be observed in different parts of the city in the morning. The maximum temperature in the capital is expected to be 24 degrees Cels,ius and the minimum temperature is between 6 and 8 degrees Celsius.

- Advertisement -

In the coming days, Delhi may experience sunshine along with occasional light rain. Winds are also expected to blow at a speed of 30 to 40 kilometres per hour. People have been advised to remain vigilant. For 3-4 days, the area may be enveloped in dense fog in the early morning hours.

Himachal Pradesh Weather

The IMD has predicted that cold wave conditions will continue in Himachal Pradesh. A yellow alert for severe cold has been issued for parts of five districts: Kangra, Mandi, Una, Bilaspur, and Hamirpur. According to the IMD, the weather is expected to remain dry until Wednesday.

Read More: Online Earning Ideas: Earn Up to ₹70 Lakh Per Month From Home Using These 7 Websites.

Read More: Moto X70 Air Pro Phone is Launching Today- With Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Gen 5 Chipset, Check All Features & Price

Due to the arrival of another powerful Western Disturbance, a new spell of snowfall and rain is expected in the state between Thursday and Saturday. This Western Disturbance is expected to affect Northwest India from Wednesday onwards.

Weather forecast for Uttar Pradesh

The Meteorological Department has predicted a change in the weather in Uttar Pradesh in the coming days. Between January 22 and 25, light to moderate rainfall is expected in some parts of the western regions of the state. A ​​warning has also been issued for light to moderate rain in eastern Uttar Pradesh on January 23 and 24. Dense fog is likely to prevail during the morning and night hours for the next two to three days, which may reduce visibility.

Rain in other regions

The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted thunderstorms and rain in various parts of Kerala, Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh, and Karnataka. Light rain is also possible in some areas of Telangana and Mahe, where caution is advised.
